content.detailedDescription:
On july 4, 2011 approximatley 22:15, i was walk down the street and i seen an object in the sky i belive it to be a ufo.
it looked like a big ball of fire, about half the size of a baby, small but large to see something like i did in this night sky. the object moved towards me from a far  distantance, it made sort of a circular motion and they back and forth very fast. 
 	i then grabed my phone to take a picture, the picture on my phone did not look like what i seen in the sky when i took the picture, thats what got to me, it then stood there like something was watching me for about 3 mins, and then quickly went away it just vanished into the east sky. i then called authority to seek answers they told me i was crazy, i personally dont belive i am, and knowone belived me, and that scares me! 
	 i as a u.S. citizen  personally did not belive in these type of things untill i came face to face i am petrified, worried , and i need answers, is it what i thik it was? 
	 what did i see was it a ufo, it was fourth of july could it have been fire works? i dont know, but it didnt look noramal to me!!
content.summary: Firey object in the night sky, looks to a ufo

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i went out to watch fireworks and saw the first orange object track across the sky, a few minutes later there was a second object. we finally realised that we could record on our olympus digital camera. we continued to film everytime we saw another object show up. at one point there were 4 objects in the sky and an airplane passed by them heading the other direction. caught on tape, some of our neighbors saw them as well. finally i climbed onto the roof top to try to get the tree line out of the camera shot. cloudy night, no wind, and no visiable stars. the objects did not seem to flash, later when we viewed the video they seemed to pulse. no blinking lights like an airplane, we even took video of a plane to show that, and there was no sound like in the video of the plane video. on video, also,we show one object with a plane near by. all objects travelled almost the same path. south east to north west. we are not saying that they were extraterrestial but definitely unexplained. all this occured roughly from 930pm to 11pm in orlando florida on july 4th 2011. we at first thought it was a firework but when it travelled across miles of sky we realised it was not a firework or a flare. plus there were too many of them. they disappeared into the night sky. i have already posted the film on youtube and facebook. i do have it copied to a flash drive for mufon and have not deleted it for the camera.
content.summary: Videoed 12 plus over the course of 2 hours orange in colour

content.detailedDescription: We went to the fireworks display for the july 4th celebration. we parked about a mile away from the display that was set to start at 9pm in the northeastern sky, in a grassy area just off a street facing the eastern sky. we arrived at approx. 8:45pm. there we actually two sightings that occurred. just before the fireworks were to start at approx. 8:55pm i looked to the southern sky and saw what i thought was an airplane with landing lights on, but it looked like it was on fire! it was a red fireball that seemed to hoover, not advancing to land or taking off in a direction. hoovering. it was from where we were standing the size of 2-3 stars put together. no sound. it was hoovering for about 30 sec. then i and my husband looked to the east sky and there was another object that looked identical to the one in the southern sky probably about 1/2 mile apart from each other. again hoovering. we looked back at the one in the southern sky and the fireball started moving towards the west and before our eyes disappeared. looked back to the eastern sky and that object slowly started moving toward the northern sky and all the sudden disappeared. about 5 minutes later the fireworks started and lasted for about 25 mins. no sightings during the display. about 3 min. after the finale of the fireworks we were getting back into the car and was looking at the southern sky again and the object reappeared at the same spot it was last seen when it disappeared. a red fireball, no sound. my husband used his iphone to take a video of it, but not able to see anything when we tried to play it back. the fireball slowly started moving to the west again, but it was in slow motion. it was there for about 3 min. it seemed to just burn out or disappear again. never seen anything like this in my life.
content.summary: Two fireball shaped objects appeared before the fireworks event started and disappeared. then one fireball appeared after the fireworks and disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: Two orange flickering objects passed overhead within a few minutes of each other.  they almost looked like hot air balloons but they were quiet and moved too fast. about 2 minutes (not timed) to pass from se sky to nw.  neighbor thought there was a turn in the path, but i thought it looked more like a straight path.  the latter seemed slightly more westward.  no blinking lights as would be on a plane.  also orange light did not resemble any landing lights.  light really appeared flamelike.  no noise as would be expected from a plane.  it was maybe 30-50 minutes after sunset, so i'm now thinking these "may" have been satellites passing overhead with sun reflactions.  although this explanation does not sit well, as the objects appeared larger than any satellite passover i've ever seen.   makes me wondering if this is the same object mentioned in the hannibal report.  also wondered if this was the shuttle meeting up with the iss, but don't know what paths the iss and shuttle are taking.  oh well, maybe you guys can figure out what it was.  would like to find out.
content.summary: Two flickering orange objects track se to nw a few minutes apart

content.detailedDescription: I was with my daughter and 2 friends at elitch gardens, denver, colorado for the 4th of july fireworks.  we were waiting for the show to start and at approx 9:45 pm we looked up and saw a ball of yellow/orange glowing light traveling west to east at about the same speed as an airplane.  at first glance it appeared to be some sort of chinese lantern because it was flickering like a candle, but i quickly realized that it was too high up to be a lantern.  i watched it until it disappeared inside a cloud.  about 5 minutes or so later, two more of these orbs came by.  they too were going west to east as well.  they were traveling in a straight line and were a pretty good distance apart.  i also watched them until they went inside a cloud.  i did not notice anything during the firework show as my attention was on the fireworks.  after the show ended, we were on our way back to the car and i saw another one pass by.  same area of the sky as the other three, and traveling the same way.  i am trying to figure out what they were.  was kind of baffled by it.  i have never seen anything like it!  it was fascinating but a little creepy at the same time.  have there been any other reports of these orbs in the denver or colorado area either on the 4th of july or the last week?
content.summary: Yellow/orange.  flickered like a candle but was not a lantern.  very bright.

content.detailedDescription:
Everything in this report is 100% correct and factual. i have no reason to make up or fabricate anything, i have no other reason other than to try and explain what i saw on this day, and the incredible impact that it has had on me all these many years later. it is not my intention to try and convince the naysayer and nonbelievers, but i will be honest and forthright with the events that transpired on this day. people can conclude what they will from this, but the people who know me, know that i am not capable of making up stories, or lying for that matter. why did i wait to write now after so many years have passed, or for that matter to bring it up at all? perhaps it is all the events going on in the world right now. there are so many strange events happening all over the planet. it is no secret that more and more ufo sightings are happening on a regular basis. i���m writing this report for my own personal reasons. the people that i choose to share this with will most likely be close friends and family. i have no reason to try and get any form of recognition, and certainly not looking for any kind of fame or glory. while i still can, i want to convey this event as accurately as possible, and with as much detail as i can remember. one of my regrets is that i did not go straight home and write down the exact date that this occurred. in the last 10 years or so, i have been keeping very accurate records of day to day events, rarely skipping any. sadly during this time period, i didn���t give much credence to such things and therefore did not keep up with particulars. as far as my biggest regret with this encounter, would have to be the fact that i did not have a camera or video recorder in order to substantiate my story. if only i did, they would most certainly be some of the most revealing up close and in great detail, as ever witnessed by anyone. i say this not to boast, but to simply state a fact. i have seen probably hundreds of videos on you tube, some really good, some bad, others down right stupid or a hoax. i am convinced that what i saw would have afforded me a visit from the so called ���men in black���. it would have been that spectacular, and set the standard by which all skeptics would have to admit- what was that? the aforementioned is the forward of my story. what follows will be the time line of what happened on this memorable day, one that i will never forget.

while i don���t know the exact date that this occurred, i do know that it was the winter of 1996, around november or december. i know this because the days were short, and all the leaves had fallen off the trees- this i know for sure. i was working at milliken design center in lagrange georgia. my normal work hour was 8:00 ��� 5:00 o���clock, monday through friday- a typical office schedule. it was not uncommon for me to work over an extra hour when ever necessary. on this particular day, i shut down my computer and prepared to leave the building at exactly 5:45pm. i remember a gentleman walking ahead of me, approximately 50��� feet or so. he exited the side parking lot door first, a few seconds later i did the same. he already had a head start going to his car, which was towards the left as you walk out the side doors. my car was parked more to the right as you walked out the door. i will try to give a reference as to where his car was, as apposed to mine. it was at this moment (after leaving the building) that i first saw the unidentified flying object with my peripheral vision. at that very moment the object had just came from the right corner of the building. it was at a very low altitude, approximately 80��� ��� 100��� feet in the air. it was traveling from a sw direction (215��� azimuth), going in a ne direction (35��� azimuth), at a line sight elevation of approximately 35���- 40��� degrees. it was moving at a very low rate of speed, thus giving me plenty of time to observe it. it made absolutely no sound at all- none whatsoever. perhaps the one thing that caught my eye first was the huge bright light on the underside of the craft. it was so bright that at times it was hard to look at. the top portion of the craft was shiny silver metallic. i remember thinking how strange that this craft had appendages sticking outward from the sides, different geometric sizes and shapes- something that i would later refer to as probes. of course i can���t be 100% percent sure what they were, but that is what it appeared to me as. as mentioned above, the craft moved or hovered slowly from a south westerly direction going towards the north east. once it came somewhat over the parking lot, i could see it plainly, making out the distinct shape and approximate size of the craft. at the time of this sighting, i drove a 1980 white cadillac fleetwood brougham. the size of this model car is 18.5��� feet long. given this fact and judging the height and distance of the craft, and the proximity to where i was standing- i estimated the object as being approximately 25��� feet in circumference. it was not a huge craft by no means, but was certainly capable of being maneuvered or controlled by some kind of intelligent life form. as the craft hovered slowly over the parking lot and past over the trees in the median, separating actually two parking lots, it continued moving in the north east direction. i never took my eyes off the object the whole time, and as it moved on across the parking lot and almost over the main road in front of the office complex, it did something that defied all explanation of physics. it went from moving slow, let���s say 5 mph, to an accelerated speed so fast, the only way to describe it would be: ���shooting a bullet��� out of the barrel of a gun- basically a streak, then it was gone. i have read similar cases of flying objects doing the same thing as i have described here. all one has to do is go to you tube and type in ���ufo���, it wouldn���t take long to find some videos showing similar maneuvers. an example would be to type in the phrase on you tube: ���ufo over river in italy���, then you could understand the velocity by which i am describing. i am convinced that america nor any other county on this planet has anything in its military arsenal that could come close to what i witnessed. let me say for the record: this was not an airplane, jet, helicopter, balloon or anything else of this earth. i certainly don���t need to be told that it was ���swamp gas��� or the planet ���venus���, or anything else that would insult my intelligent. what i saw was real, it really did happen, it took place exactly as i have outlined here, and no i am not crazy by a long shot. 

summary: the gentleman walking out the door ahead of me to his car never saw this object. as soon as i saw this object, i wanted to yell to this gentleman and say: ���hey man, do you see that���, but i was literally speechless, the words would not come out. i was so in awe at the sight of this ufo, that i just could not take my eyes off it- not even for a second. the funny thing about this whole scenario- i could remember telling myself that ���this is a real ufo that i���m looking at���. i just knew immediately what it was, but at the same time i couldn���t believe that it was right there in front of me, in all its wonder and  mystery. 

note:  on july 2nd, 2011- i did travel back to the place where this event took place and took several pictures. i used the aid of my old compass in order to get an accurate bearing on where i was standing, in relation to what direction the craft was traveling. keep in mind these photos were taken in the middle of summer, with the trees full of leaves, not to mention these trees have grown considerably over the past 15 years. 

i have used the aid of ���google map��� in order to show a satellite view from space, the office complex where i worked at the time (mdc). i even have a picture of what my white cadillac looked like in order to give some credence to the size of this object. the ufo was slightly larger in circumference than that of my car, but it was the only thing at the time that i could reference in describing the objects size. lastly, i found a picture on the internet that somewhat closely resembled the object in question. please note that i did use software on my computer (mgi photosuite iv) to help further enhance the photo. it was my intention to show a truer comparison to what i saw on that day. it is not precisely the same in every detail, but certainly very close. one exception worth mentioning here is that the photo that i have is darker, the actual ufo was very shiny and metallic on top. the bottom was somewhat darker than the top due to the lighting outside, except for one huge light in the middle- this was amazingly luminous. 

the information that i have provided is true. this report is mainly for my own personal recollection. if other people read this and are inspired- that would great. if others read it and think its hog-wash, that���s ok too. it is not my intention to make people believe me. i do think people should open their minds to the possibility that we humans are arrogant, if we think that we are the only intelligent beings in the universe. 




















date: july 3rd, 2011
content.summary: Ufo encounter at mdc

content.detailedDescription:
Was sitting about two blocks from atlantic ocean -was dark outside at that time-saw a distant object seemingly
 rising in a straight line at about 60-65 degrees to my right- watched it for several minutes and then it disappeared behind a grove of trees and never saw it again. the only reason i'm reporting it is because of it's color which was a pure bright yellow[did not give off sunlight as i've seen sattelites that reflected grayish white sunlight. it was just a pure fairly bright yellow. i've never heard of any aircraft that projected nothing but yellow light. hope  to hear from someone.I'm not yet amember, but anyone who is sincerely interested may call me on my cell phone (phone number deleted)fg first name is (name deleted)fg.
content.summary: Object, because of it's distance, appeared starlike- was sitting outside and objedt was riisng over atlantic ocean slowly in a straigtht line, faster thann a star or venus and was bright yellow.

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i were sitting on the elevated train tracks watching the westminster fourth of july fireworks.  the tracks were so high, we were able to see fireworks displays all around us (4 or more). 

suddenly, a new group of lights appeared that didn't seem to be a part of any of the fireworks shows.  

what we saw were 3-4 lights looking like a child's drawing of a "falling star" with a pointed star at the front or vaguely like a comet.  these objects appeared to us as the most active fish swimming in a fish bowl.  at this point i stood and exclaimed "what the hell is that?"

i stood and took a few steps and tried frantically to assess / debunk what we were seeing.

our first thought was that these were some type of fireworks - obviously, but we disagree with that for several reasons. 

1.  duration - we watched 50 fireworks launch and explode during the duration of the phenomena.  the sighting lasted at least 60 seconds, maybe longer.

2.  incredibly slow descent / moments of vertical motion - as the objects were swirling (imagine a bicycle wheel turning), it was clear the objects were gaining altitude during the motion.  

3.  size - these objects were far larger then the bits of firework.  if i held my hand up, the whole show could be covered with two thumbs, and each object about half the size of my pinky nail. 

4.  isolation - while there were several shows going on (and several individuals lighting off store-variety fireworks), these objects seemed completely isolated, about 5 miles away from us.  

our second thought was flares.  but i wonder can flares move vertically?  do they have tails that appear opposite their direction of motion?

as the phenomena continued, the lights seemed to blink in and out (smoke from fireworks blocking?).  the lights continued to descend, spiraling, until they seemed to blink out just above the horizon. 

my wife and i were very excited and convinced there must have been thousands of witnesses.
content.summary: We witnessed 3-4 objects rotating in a circle, blinking in and out

content.detailedDescription:
On the evening of july 1 2011, 3 others and i were witness to an unknown craft flying overhead. it was a clear, warm evening close to 8:30pm est with only a slight breeze from the northwest. there were few clouds in the sky and the cloud deck appeared to be several thousand feet for those that were present. we had just arrived at my mother���s home on silver lake in kinderhook michigan (south of coldwater michigan) and gotten our stuff unpacked. we were sitting outside of her garage watching my dog wandering around the yard, staring at the lake and just enjoying the beauty of the evening and being there. 

out of the west/southwest, i noticed a red light appear above the tree line, moving toward our location. that area has several smaller airports that many aeronautical enthusiasts frequent. it is common to see ���things��� flying about. given the topography of the area, it is generally easy to identify those enthusiasts and their machines quickly. this was not one of those things.

the light held a steady brilliant red glow as it approached the lake. about the time it reached the opposite shore line moving towards us, i began pointing and saying my son���s name to gain his attention. he looked where i was pointing and said ���what is that?��� as he said that, the other two witnesses also looked at where i was pointing. it was moving about the speed of an ultra light aircraft as it came across the lake.  initially my son declared it a plane. 

in my view, as others got a ���fix��� on it and began looking intently, the red light went out. the craft continued across the lake towards us in darkness. it was initially the traditional ���saucer��� shape round with a small dome. the size was roughly the size of a four-seated cessna aircraft common in the area. the coloring was completely ink black. it passed overhead less than 300 yards away and about 1,000 feet above the ground, without sound. the harder i tried to look at it, the less i could see detail. almost simultaneously, we all verbally declared that this was not a plane. this is where we all in our own ways began saying the ���oh my god what is that��� and ���that���s not a plane��� things to each other as it passed overhead. 

i began asking for a camera or my binoculars. the cameras were still in our bags in our rooms, but my binoculars were right in the garage. my fianc���e ran into the garage behind us and grabbed them for me. the rest of us never took our eyes off it. 

there is a large farmer���s field across the street from my mother���s house, and during the time it took my fianc���e to get those for me, the object had only just crossed the length of the field, heading north, northwest. i trained my binoculars on it (10x50 power) and was able to follow it with them until it passed below the tree line.  as i watched the object, i tried to discern details such as wings, or edges to it. it appeared to alter shape slightly, as a loosely filled balloon would in a breeze. this was no balloon though. what continues to stand out in my mind is the blackness. no edges or details were visible at all within the boundaries of the objects outline. it was just blackness. it was kind of like watching a round black hole float across the sky, with its edges slightly blurred and its outline wobbling.

as i watched it approach the tops of the trees in the distance, the object made a subtle shift up and to its right, and then dove downward and left at a 45-degree angle. it disappeared behind the treetops and i could not locate it after that. 

it was not until several stunned moments afterwards, that i realized it had not made a sound. i mentioned that, and everyone was again stunned and in agreement in realizing that it in fact did not make a sound. considering how close it was to us, there was no way we could not have heard even the smallest of engines. it is very quiet and calm out there and you can hear even just birds from a long distance off. this made absolutely no sound whatsoever. 

my mother has lived there for many years now, and i have seen all types of aircraft and balloons launched from local airports. this was none of those things. it was far too light outside and too clear, for us to mistake it for anything else at that distance. normal aircraft flying overhead at that altitude are very visible and audible to the point of almost being able to read their call signs with the naked eye and tell how many cylinders the aircraft is running on. it was also traveling across the mild breeze at about a 45-degree angle, and i feel confident in ruling out a free-floating balloon based on that alone.  we do not know what we seen, but we all seen something truly amazing.
content.summary: Four witnesses see a black object pass overhead 1,000 ft. up, in clear light.

content.detailedDescription:
Me and my neighbors were watching fire works last night. it was still kinda light out and we all just looked up & outta where over our neighbors roof a big glowing orange reddish ufo appeared over my neighbors roof top. we said what the fu** is that!!! multiple neighbors witnessed this craft it was like a fire ball in the mddel and a saucer/triangel shape on the bottom. you could see the out line of the ball on top and circular/triangel shape below and it was raidating. it hovered for a minuetand & i sent my sister in 4 a camera and it started moving down my street. i followed it it went into the clouds and tried to hide its self as a cloud. but you could still see the red glow in the lil bit of clouds it was in. when it came out the clouds it shrunk majorly in size and it looked like a baby baby cloud flying down the street but you could still see orange reddish craft inside. we took some pictures i have to down load the to the computer & hop they come out. the pics we took was of the craft disgusied in the baby cloud. so ill have some pics hopefully a.S.A.P 4 you. i need the usb to download. hopefully it looks good. me and numerous witnesses followed this craft down the other block & it dissappeared. i took off when i sent my sister in the house for the camers and i was following it. like it noticed us following it and "ran" off. and it was weird how we noticed it because the fire works were on the opposite side down a few blocks. outt no where all 5 of us just turned and looked and said what the f*ck is that. no chance in hell it was a plane or a fire work!!!!!! a plane woulda fell out da sky at that low low heigh! and no fire work is hovering and cloaking its self!!!

we werw all blown away and amazed and excited!!!
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Reddish orange glowin ufo right above roof top. hovered turned traveled & hid in clouds still moving.

content.detailedDescription: I was working at the mcdonalds drive thru when i saw a massive orange object that looked like a flame but seemed to be made of a gel like appearance.  it came from the southwest and passed directly over me in the drive thru.  i experienced a burning sensation on my face.
content.summary: A flame like object was coming from the southwest direction across hwy 65 and directly over the drive thru where i was working at mcdonalds in alabaster, alabama.  it was orange and had a gel like appearance.

content.detailedDescription: Laying in bed looking out of the skylight last night at 11:33 pm , i saw a roundish red object moving across the night sky from west to east.  at first i thought it was a sattelite but it was too big and moving too fast.  i pointed it out to my girlfriend and we watched it for a several  tens of seconds.  before it went over the horizon, it appeared to take off vertically and i lost sight of it.  i looked at a video on this sight from yesterday during fireworks and it looks to be the same object.
content.summary: Red sphere or oval in sky moving west to east, then vertically out of sight.

content.detailedDescription: I tried to give a detailed descripton and it dropped the report twice. i will submit it so it is sent in you may contact me as soon as you can. i also know that a person spotted the same ufo on july 1, 2011 roughly a half mile from were it was spotted by me and this person.
content.summary: Ufo appeared and vanished in about 3 seconds

content.detailedDescription: I was standing in my driveway facing north, approx. 10:45, with 4 other people (all witnessed the same thing) 3 orange lights appeared traveling south/southwest. lights were moving very slow, not blinking, stayed in a triangle formation for a good 20-30 seconds, disappeared behind cloud and did not come out. this happened on july 4th but absolutely were not fireworks.
content.summary: 3 orange lights in triangle formation

content.detailedDescription: My girlfriend and i were out on my back deck talking and our attention was brought to a light that sudddenly appeared out of nowhere. it was very bright and we could even see the beam of light through the sky similar to landing lights on a plane going through fog or cloud cover. the light was heading in a southwest direction at first then changed to a south only direction. the light dimmed out as if it was going behind a cloud and it went away.  there were no clouds around it that we could see and there were visible stars in the same location as the light. it is possible that it climbed to a higher elevation but it looked as iff the light was slowly dimming as if caused by cloud cover. we watched for probably 20 minutes and it never reappeared.  i would estmate the altitude at 25000 ft. it lasted a total duration of approx 15 seconds before it was gone.  there were numerous aircraft in the area being as i live in the flight path to port columbus airport but this was no aircraft. the light was not going in any direction that we usually see aircraft fly in this area. i have reported one other similar sighting a number of years ago but this one was different. i never saw an actual beam of light on my first experience like we did this time. the light just prior to seeing the beam was very bright as if aimed right at us. then it moved slightly causing us to see the visible beam until it dimmed away. there was an aircraft inbound to the airport to the south of the lights original location and it appeared to be below the light when we saw it. the aircraft made no changes in its flight path as if to avoid any collision.
content.summary: Light in the sky

content.detailedDescription: My wife went out on our back deck to watch the fireworks, she was watching some going off in the distance and noticed a cylinder shaped object with red lights in the sky it was vertical going east to west, view was blocked by building she did not see it anymore. when i came out she told me about it. our town fireworks started a short time later and i filmed the end of the grand finally, we saw a red ball of light come up from the right go above where the fireworks were and go east to west turn and went toward the northwest and disappear, it was cylinder shaped and brilliant red light that faded when it just disappeared, it all happened in under a minute, i was shaking and trying to film and accidently turned of the camera off but i did get a few seconds of this sighting,
content.summary: Ufo sighting right at the end of fireworks display

content.detailedDescription:
I was about to fall asleep, when i heard a couple of thumps come from my wall and ceiling. i thought it was nothing, but something urged me to look out my window. i saw a very bright star in a place that it had never been before. i grabbed my glasses to see the star a bit more clearly. it sure was a very bright star, and not only that but i could manage to see a faint diagonal cross(x) behind it. the more i looked at it the more it started moving. at first i thought it was just a star, but after seeing it move i thought it was and airplane or a helicopter, but it  couldn't have been either because of the way it was hovering at first.
first it got bigger so i assumed it was getting closer. i got scared and turned around, but my curiosity got the better of me and i looked out the window again. it ended up moving slightly up and down then left and right. it slowly started moving behind a tree, but was still visible. i went to another room to see if it would still be there, but it wasn't. i went back to my room to notice that it got closer to hiding behind the tree. i went to grab my camera to record what else would happen (it only took me 5 seconds to get it), but it was gone when i got back. when this happened i was upset because i didn't get it on camera and then i ran out of my room, scared, because i had a feeling that they knew that i was looking.
content.summary: Now i believe.

content.detailedDescription: My boyfriend and i were in our bedroom watching fireworks out our window from 9:15pm-10pm. around 9:40pm we noticed two bright red lights off in the distance. they were very bright, and for a second we thought they were some sort of firework. but, we had never seen any firework like that before. this was different, the lights hovered for a few seconds and in slow motion started to desend vertically. the light was so bright that it caused the light to stretch out and cause a cross in each light. when it began to desend it appeared that there was some smoke rising above the object as an exhaust of some sort. i was confused, shocked, and scared at what i was seeing. my boyfriend was confused as to what it was also, but chalked it up to being fireworks. we did get a picture of one of the lights before it was out of sight, but we lost sight of both the objects when it went below the tree line.
content.summary: 2 bright red lights appeared in sky then proceeded to desend vertically

content.detailedDescription: My boyfriend and i were in our bedroom watching fireworks out our window from 9:15pm-10pm. around 9:40pm we noticed two bright red lights off in the distance. they were very bright, and for a second we thought they were some sort of firework. but, we had never seen any firework like that before. this was different, the lights hovered for a few seconds and in slow motion started to desend vertically. the light was so bright that it caused the light to stretch out and cause a cross in each light. when it began to desend it appeared that there was some smoke rising above the object as an exhaust of some sort. i was confused, shocked, and scared at what i was seeing. my boyfriend was confused as to what it was also, but chalked it up to being fireworks. we did get a picture of one of the lights before it was out of sight, but we lost sight of both the objects when it went below the tree line.
content.summary: 2 bright red lights appeared in sky then proceeded to desend vertically

content.detailedDescription:
At 11:25 (23:25) local was looking out the window and saw a bright red light headed in a south westerly direction approximately 3 thousand feet (3,000 feet),moving very slowly with no sound, it had a green, red and white light, then, then the lights slowly disappeared, for a five (5) minutes then the object headed in an easterly direction, very slowly again then disappeared.
 i am an air force veteran and know all the aircraft. triangle shape and and no noise,sorry no photos picture was very out of focus, i couldn't  make out the shape.
content.summary: Started out as three close lights then formed three lights  then 3 lights appeared

content.detailedDescription: At about 10:06 i looked out of my balcony doors that face west. the night was clear fireworks were going off in the sky the wind was calm. i thought at first it was fireworks but it was the same red light i saw 2 nights ago. it was bright red it didn't move it just hovered high in the sky. an airplane happen to fly below it slowly so i know for sure it wasn't an airplane. it doesn't last very long but it starts getting smaller and smaller then just disappears quickly!! two nights prior july 2nd 2011 as my friend and i were driving at night we saw the same light and it did the same thing this was around 10 o'clock. it just hovered there and then disappeared this was in palos park il. on july 3rd that same friend called me and said they saw the light again this time over alsip, il this was around 8 o'clock.
content.summary: Red circular light in the sky

content.detailedDescription: On july 4, 2011 around 9:30pm, i stepped outside onto my porch to take a look around at the sky.  in the direction towards phoenix from mesa, az, i noticed rain clouds in the distant. while looking at the clouds, i noticed the clouds producing lightning which mainly just lights up the clouds.  occasionally i would see a streak of small, crooked lighting bolts being produced and branching across the cloud cell, but none of the lightning bolt went to the ground.  while observing what seems like a constant cloud lightning, i saw in one of the cloud lightning occurrence produced a pure ball of white light at the end of a lightning bolt and occurrence which the ball of light was by itself for at least 2 or 3seconds. the size of the pure white ball would be about the same size of a jet or plane for that distant or just a white dot in the sky.  i'm reporting this because i have never seen after lightning has been made and the bolt gone, leave behind after the lighting flash just a pure, white ball of light just hovering for about 2 or 3 seconds.  from my perspective, it almost seemed like there was a round object that might had been in front of the clouds which lightning may had hit a ball object and lit it up for 2 or 3 seconds. when i continued to watch the cloud produce more cloud lightning in the same general area, i never did see that pure white ball of light again. i went into the house to get my video camera, then i went back outside and started filming some of the cloud lightning. i haven't review the video tape yet; however, if i happen to see that ball of light on that video, i will notify mufon and reference this report.
content.summary: Hovering white ball of light  by a cloud after lightning stroke.

content.detailedDescription:
We were watching fireworks--my six-year-old son, and our adult friend. after one burst of fireworks, a light came flying just above it. at first, it looked like fragments of the explosion, but it didn't fade, or drop. it kept coming. we noticed it was large at that time, and seemingly under control. it approached from the northwest, and flew eastward after coming over our house.

it was fairly low to the ground. as low as the small planes that were flying in the area at the time.

it glowed dull orange, and my friend asked, "is it behind the clouds?" but the sky was absolutely clear. the glow was odd, though. not all that bright. like burning paper.

as the object came over our house, it faded to a blue color. i could tell that it looked like a triangle. i watched it fly over, silently. it continued on, over the horizon, going behind a tree on its way. it went very quickly. my friend couldn't see it anymore after it flew over our house. she complained about not having her glasses.

about five minutes later, three more appeared. they approached from the same direction, flying in a triangle pattern. they split apart as they came closer, and one of them disappeared from our view faster than the others. two remained in our sights, and went behind a tree in front of us. both came out on the other side of the tree, but one shot off in a northern direction, while the other slowly flew over us, changing direction slightly, and as it flew eastward, disappeared from our view. 

having seen the other one change color, and fade nearly completely into the sky, i'm pretty sure the same thing happened with the others.

the whole event lasted fifteen minutes or so. i took photos, but they're shaky, and the lights look distant. i did get video of them, too.
content.summary: Four glowing triangular lights flew over the fireworks. one that passed directly overhead changed to blue.

content.detailedDescription:
i���m not sure what i saw tonight but i was out watching the local fireworks this evening when a bright glow caught the corner of my eye that seemed out of place. it was a bright reddish-orange glow to the northwest high in the sky.  at first i thought maybe it was a pyrotechnic but the glow stayed suspended in one spot and didn���t seem to move.  i continued to watch for about a minute when it started to dim slightly. after another 15 or so seconds more it completely disappeared.  i compared it to the other stars that were out and it definitely had a reddish-orange hue, glowed much brighter than the other stars and seemed to pulse for a few seconds before going completely away.

  one thought was that it might have been a meteorite burning up in the atmosphere; however, i���ve seen meteorites before and this one didn���t have the characteristic streaking and didn���t seem to move at all.  the only movement i noted was at the end before it disappeared, at which point it took on the shape of a straight line about three to four times the original width, then blinked out.  from my vantage point there seemed to be a slight discernable shape of an l.  aside from this brief instance of 1.25 min., i���ve never witnessed anything like this before. i���m figuring maybe a falling object burning up in the atmosphere except for the fact that it just seemed suspended in mid air.

  it happened at approximately 2230 pst on monday july 4, 2011.  the object was spotted to the nne of hermiston, or and i would say it was directly due east of kennewick, wa.  the fireworks had just ended in the hermiston area and i was heading into the house when i noticed a bright orange glow between the leaves of a tree in our front yard.  when i stopped i continued to stare at the glow and went to the side of the tree to see it more clearly.  what i saw from that point on is what i just described above.

the picture that i'm attaching is my recreation of the incident and not an actual photograph.
content.summary: Bright reddish-orange glowing object

content.detailedDescription: We were watching the neighborhood fireworks when i looked over to the south - east and saw one or two bright (brighter than any plane or helicopter) lights coming over the horizon. i told my dad who was also outside "look, ufos!" he walked over to take a look and we both realized that one, they were ufos, and two, we could see more approaching. i started filming (i'll attach the video) and you can see the rest of what happens there. we have concluded that these craft were not likely to be chinese lanterns because of their overwhelming brightness while at a great distance and altitude and their ability to stay in formation with each other and all go off at the same time. there were also hundreds of spectators that saw a triangular formation in a town nearby (about 14 miles away).
content.summary: 6 orange balls of light move in formation

content.detailedDescription:
We were in an open desert lot, near 14th street and cherry st. waiting for the 4th of july 2011 fireworks to begin.  looked like fireworks were warming up to start, as a few tester fireworks had gone off.  

thought at first it was one of the roundish globe fireworks.  but it moved up, then out and then forward.  then i thought a piece of the firework was going to land in the field and catch on fire, as another one had just gone over and landed nearby us.  but no fire, as it had just rained.  today was the start of a slight monsoon rain, black clouds, thunder and lightening.

then i realized it wasn't part of the firework and said omg it's a huge fireball!  we thought it was going to land in the field we were in.

then i said, omg, no i bet it's a huge meteor!!! then i noticed the outer red light looked less fireball like, and started to pan left and right.  then it slightly turned and started to come in our direction!  

at this point i was still disoriented thinking a meteor was getting ready to smash down and was wondering if there was more and, when it came in our direction i was concerned it was going to hit us.  i was just trying to figure out which way we should move to be safe.

my boyfriend got out of his chair at that point, as he wasn't sure either.  after it turned in our direction, and we moved, then it straightened back up and flew right over head.

it was low... slow... and gradual moving...With no sound!!!  we both mentioned there was no sound.  it passed over head and then just faded into the distance.

we never saw something like that!!!  was very different!  hope others noticed it too!  good luck on your quest and if you know anything please feel free to share! :)  i knew i should have brought a camera! :(
content.summary: White glowing inner light, bright glowing red outer light.  slow moving no sound.

content.detailedDescription: I was on my way home on the 22 frwy west when 2 large orange glowing orbs caught my attention to the north west of me. i pulled off the freeway to get my binoculars out and was curious to see what exactly it was. when i did so all i could see was a glow of orange in a something like glass ball.  the one light farthest away dimmed out and disappeared and then the 2nd one did the same. amazed, i started back onto the streets when i noticed 2 more glowing orange orbs. i then pulled over again and tried to take my camera out to record but those too dimmed and disappeared. when looking through the binoculars i did not see any blinking lights to indicate an airplane. and these moved very slowly and disappeared. crazy! dont know if anyone else saw. lots of people out tonight too with lighting up fireworks. i saw the first 2 lights at 10:29pm and the 2nd lights at 10:37pm.
content.summary: Glowing orange orbs

content.detailedDescription: I was driving home from marysville indian reservation after lighting off fireworks. travelling southbound i-5 and getting close to the 164th st exit i noticed a ball of red and white light hovering on the east side of i-5. as i drove closer i knew it was not a cell tower and there were fireworks going off underneath it. it hovered and didn't move and i took the 164th street exit to get some water at the well. then i looked up i was not in direct line of sight. then filled up my water bottle and proceed back on i-5 south and i pulled over to the shoulder and see i that object again and i located it. this time it was moving and heading east in fast rate of speed as it was climbing. the light was getting dimmer as it was travelling away. then i noticed a second object trailing it and departed in the same manner. i filmed it on my cellphone but it could not pick it up. this was not a plane or a helicopter and i know when see those types of aircraft.
content.summary: Glowing red and white ball 2 of them

content.detailedDescription: Our family was in our front yard lighting fireworks and watching the surrounding fireworks when we noticed what we thought at first was a flare that someone had shot into the air. at first it was bright red and moving slowly from north to south. as we watched we could see that it was obviously not a flare as the altitude and speed remained constant. it appeared to hesitate occasionally but that could have been my imagination. it also made absolutely no sound. it slowly changed color from bright red to white and seamed to flicker or pulsate every 30 seconds or so. after approx. 4 minutes of slowly moving in a southerly direction it gradually faded away.
content.summary: Very bright light moving in a southerly direction.

content.detailedDescription: We were watching a fireworks display in augusta, kentucky, but we were parked across the river on the riverbanks of between eutopia and higginsport, ohio.  during the fireworks display (maybe 30-40 minutes into it), we suddenly noticed a orange glowing object appear and rise slowly to the height where the fireworks were bursting.  then, it slowly came out towards us to approximately the center of the river before ascending off into the sky and getting much smaller in appearance, almost resembling a star, but with a orange to red sparkle & emission of light around it.  it appeared to go back and forth slightly only moving a little.  approximately 10 minutes later, during the grande finale, something caught our eye off to our right, and it was another orange glowing object but seemed closer yet smaller than the first one.  within seconds, while our son was getting the camera phone out of the truck, we looked for it again, and it was gone, but the other still remained high in the sky.
content.summary: Orange glow shape in the sky during fireworks event
